Hotel Gotham
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 129 reviews

Fantastic hotel, close to restaurants, theatres and shops.Staff so polite and helpful, really make this hotel special.

i imagine could be noisy in street at weekends as large restaurant across the road and our room faced it, we stayed on a Thursday at Christmas and there was some noise until midnight. Recommend this hotel .

Show more
Marilyn , United Kingdom
La Reserve Aparthotel
9 Excellent
Based on 134 reviews

Friendly efficient staff, spotlessly clean apartments which were a treat after days at work meetings - making own snacks/tea.

Lovely lobby. Small shop to the left across the road. 3mins down the street to the rt on piccadilly street are several larger shops for food/drink. Aldi to the left 5mins away. Piccadilly station less than 10mins away walking which allows easy transport to the airport via both train or tram - we chose tram as we had the time. Very central. Matt & Phreds , less than 10mins walk , in the Northern Quarter was a great find to relax for live music and delicious food at great value. Nearby tram handy for getting about if needed but we chose to walkl to convention centre for work meetings and deansgate st. no problem. Tip: higher up floors helpful to reduce noise from passing traffic. Overall 100% and will be back again.

Show more
Karen , Ireland
The Principal Manchester
9 Excellent
Based on 77 reviews

Fire alarm went off at 6am in morning and had to stand out in street for 45 mins in pyjamas. Staff made no attempt to pacify or look after guests.

Holiday Inn Express across road refused guests waiting out on street to use their toilet facilities. One staff member indicated real fire, only to find out later that it wasn't and the same thing had happened exactly same time day before. Staff should have been more attentive to guests at the time and more apologetic. Also we arrived at the hotel at 4.30pm in afternoon and room was not ready! Got taken to a room which wasn't even made up to the embarrassment of the bellboy who took us up to the room. Room was reserved for 2 adults and 2 children, only to find 2 bath towels in room ! Would not stay again and would recommend to avoid if possible.

Show more
Karim , United Kingdom
Britannia Manchester Hotel
7 Very good
Based on 432 reviews

Although the britannia came up as the cheapest for the weekend we wanted, I really wish we d paid that little bit extra for something much nicer.

We did want to try and keep the weekend cheap as possible but for £20 more we could of stayed in the palace, a much better hotel! The location is the best thing about the hotel as its central to everything and the outside of the building is amazing but that's all I can say. We had a room without a window which wasn't stated by Agoda, although it was stated for other rooms about not having windows, which is fair enough but I chose this one on the basis I believed it did have windows. Room much to be desired, very very standard, and dated, dirty stained carpet, chewing gum stuck on the walls, old fashioned and dull. Bathroom ok, clean to be fair! The room even had a ashtray in it, so a room with no windows but inviting people to smoke in it? Our room didn't smell of smoke but he corridors did in places?! All in all a very well located hotel, can't beat the location but for £110 a night I would of expected a bit more and would of preferred to pay a bit more for something nicer

Show more
cathrin , United Kingdom
Innside By Meliá Manchester
8.8 Excellent
Based on 33 reviews

Pendulum Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 329 reviews

Travel around Europe in mid March 2015 and stayed at 5 different hotels. Perhaps this is the worst among all.

Stayed there for 2 nights and the hotel is located very close to the Manchester Piccadilly station (less than 10 mins walk). Nice location!! Their staff is nice but they do charge you 20 pounds for early check-in. I refused to pay, so they help to store my luggage in a room next to the reception. Hotel lobby is nice and comfortable...but the corridor is too narrow and the room as well. Terribly small room!!!! I am 5"9" tall with less than 70kg. the room is so small that I can't even walk after I opened my luggage.and the warmer is also terrible!!! It will turn off automatically after 2 hrs (well I never expect I need to wake up in the mid night to turn on the warmer for every 2hrs) and maybe I was so unlucky, a girl yelled outside my room twice in the mid night to look for somebody. (Probably a guy) Shower pressure is too low which I don't enjoy at all. It's too cold in Manchester. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!! and I totally disagree with the overall rating as "Good or 7.7" rated by other travellers!

Show more
Siu , China
Motel One Manchester-Piccadilly
8.8 Excellent
Based on 50 reviews

It's a disappointing experience. I just stayed at this hotel for less than 12 hrs. As I had to catch the train in the early morning next day, I looked for a hotel in walking distance.

To be fair, it's unquestionable that the location of the hotel is excellent. The room is tidy & chic. The room rate is reasonable. HOWEVER, these are not the reasons for me to put up with the poor customer service. The staff at the reception is rude & arrogant. I can't believe that there could be such an unprofessional staff in a hotel. You may say it's a subjective feeling, but she didn't give a greeting or even said "Thank You". When we wanted to ask about the details of the bill, she's just inpatient to explain. I don't know if it's just the problem with this staff, but I won't take the risk to book this hotel again. There are so many other choices, I won't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Show more
LEUNG , Hong Kong
Doubletree By Hilton Hotel Manchester Piccadilly
8.7 Excellent
Based on 466 reviews

We stayed in August 2013 for 3 days, walking distance from Piccadilly, and gay village, if you are into this kind of thing.

We felt pretty much disappointed with this hotel. When we arrived we could not get parking space cos its full and have to make another turn to park at next door building, The hot water at the shower is not working until our baby shaking when she had her bath, the breakfast is a bit boring. The bed is tiny really, The waiter at the room service was a bit tired perhaps, Ordered some rice with curry and they gave me Fork and knife. And the waiter service is not satisfying due the breakfast time, too rush on serving everyone. The check in was smooth, a Polish Reception lady is really helpful. The bar cocktail happy hour was Favorited by my hubby's family, as standard UK hotel, they have iron board & iron so this is helpful cos i wash my baby's clothes everyday, also kettle to warm up baby food. Overall i think its not really 4-star.

Show more
Jeremy , United Kingdom
Hotel Football Old Trafford
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 235 reviews

A friendly , informative and slick welcome from reception upon arrival. Upgraded to an executive suite with complimentary mini bar.

Thank you. Minor downside was the room itself ; No sockets at bedside tables to charge phone. Tea / coffee making facilities hidden away, and discovered when it was too late. Never found the hairdryer. However the biggest thing for me and the reason I gave an average score for value for money was the finish which was most notable in the bathroom. Economic wall and floor tiles. The whole bathroom except the shower area with circa 9 coloured tiles! Just in plain white.. On a positive note a nice touch when room turned down... Some chocolate footballs! Check out was again a masterclass in service and communication. Great job and stand outish. Would stay again

Show more
Oliver , United Kingdom
Mercure Manchester Piccadilly Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 292 reviews

we stayed in manchester to visit out daughter and celebrate out ruby anniversary. the saturday night was xtremely noisy as the hotel had a corporate do a couple in a room close to our were arguing and shouting, the fire alarm was set off, doors were banging and people didn't,t care that othereople were trying to sleep.

the following afternoon after spending the day with out daughter we returned to find we were looked out of our room so had to go to reception on our return the room hadn't been cleaned and we had no fresh towels. housekeeping then knocked on our door later in the evening we told them not to bother. the worst thing about the weekend was that my brother had arranged for champagne and chocolates to be placed in our room as a surprise - needless to say this didn't happen. a very disappointing stay and will not be returning.

Show more
Suzanne , United Kingdom
ibis Styles Manchester Portland
8.5 Excellent
Based on 51 reviews

Staff are great and super friendly. I love the informal check in atmosphere. The room is clean but a little small and cramp.

I was on the 6th floor facing picadilly garden, nice view of Picadilly 1 but I was woken up a few times at night by the screeching sound of the buses and drunkards on the strest below. Overall stay is satisfactory for a short trip as the room is just too cramp! And it definitely doesn't look like the photos on Agoda when I was booking online.

Show more
Ai , Malaysia
The Mitre Hotel
6.9 Good
Based on 79 reviews

Our experience of this hotel was awful. I emailed them on the Sunday (the night after we stayed) and have received no response.

I booked the room through Agoda as a birthday present for a friend. On arrival, we found the room was not en suite though we expected a bathroom! The bathroom facility was covered in mould. So we were unable to shower in there. The room was shabby. Dirty marks over the walls, wallpaper hanging off, mould on the bedroom ceiling, rust on the radiator, a window that didn't close properly. A plastic fork left on the floor etc My friend has severe allergies and the mould which was present aggravated her chest. We immediately went to reception and asked if we could move rooms but were informed that the hotel was fully booked. We also asked at reception for tea bags and were told by the male receptionist he would bring some to our room. However they never arrived. Look forward to hearing from you soon.

Show more
Helen , United Kingdom
Radisson Blu Edwardian Manchester Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 148 reviews

This is the first time I booked through Agoda, and it was quick and easy. The only downside of the booking was that when we (my partner and I) arrived at the hotel the room that was booked was a twin (not double).

The hotel did say that booking through a 3rd party can sometime not specify the type of room (so it's worth putting a comment in the additional/special requests box when booking). I've stayed at the Radisson Edwardian on several occasions, as the service is excellent, the rooms are modern and stylish, the cocktails are the best things about the hotel (although quite pricey apprx. £8-£10 each - highly recommended Opus in a Million, their signature cocktail) and the ambience in the bar is relaxed, yet the staff are extremely efficient and attentive. Would highly recommend for business or pleasure. Great location for shops, bars, restaurants etc!

Show more
Susan , United Kingdom
Radisson Blu Manchester Airport
8.7 Excellent
Based on 82 reviews

I think overall this hotel is good. I certainly wouldn't rate it excellent though. Upon arrival we had to take our bags to the room ourselves, there was no bottled water (and yes I know we can drink the water from the tap but really?) and the mini bar was 'locked'.

I found most of our experience a hassle to be honest. Why do I have to call to 'unlock' the mini bar? I wanted foam pillows and looked in the cupboard where in 99% of other hotels I have stayed at have them and again I had to request these. My husband went for dinner (I was ill - hence the desperate need for bottled water) and the restaurant was too busy for him to eat. So all in all I think it was a disappointment for the money. That being said, the location is truly excellent - you can literally walk straight into Terminal 2 which is very convenient.

Show more
Rachael , United Kingdom
Britannia Sachas Hotel
6.5 Good
Based on 138 reviews

I got in on new year's eve, and it was obviously quite busy. The staff seemed very frazzled, tired, exasperated.

..therefore in no mood to smile or entertain enquiries. The check-in was relatively fast, and they gave a room facing the street. The room seemed to be something out of the 1970s or 1980s, with mismatching wallpaper and upholstery, which made me feel like I was in the twilight zone for awhile. But the beds were extremely comfortable. Nice location, as its right smack in the northern quarter. Close to Arndale for shopping and eating, but seems a little dodgy at night when all the rough guys hang about the streets right outside the hotel. Kudos to the security guard who refused to let drunk rowdy ruffians into the hotel! Overall I'd say it's expensive for what you're getting, but alright if you aren't fussy.

Show more
Suzie , Singapore
Gardens Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 97 reviews

As a solo traveller with a few heavy luggages, the steps at the entrance was an inconvenience. The reception had all the document ready so checking in was a breeze.

The room smelled a little of fresh paint and everything was neat. The location was excellent, near to the main train station, the many restaurants and great bars in Northern Quarter. Everywhere else were walking distance from the hotel. Wifi connection was good. As it was one of those rare Manchester summer, the room got a little hot and I was unable to open the window to cool the room down but I guess that was for security reason. Maybe they should invest in a fan for each room for those hot summer days. The staff were professional and I had such a pleasant stay.

Show more
Siti , Singapore
Malmaison Manchester
8.4 Excellent
Based on 63 reviews

So from what we've experienced is not as we expected! From staying in the malmasion Newcastle we thought that the Manchester hotel would trump .

.. how wrong were we! After a long day working we came to the hotel to check in, the room was tiny but we were hungry so pushed aside and went to have dinner down in the restaurant to be served burnt over seasoned steak and my wife's was mostly fat and watery! As we were tired and don't like to make a fuss we paid over £70 for the meal and went back to our room to settle for the night. What an awful sleep! The mattress was horrendous and the gurgling from the bathroom was just the hight of annoying. Following the worst night sleep ever we went for breakfast and to check out. After exchanging emails with the manager for a while to be offered another stay there for £65!!!! We most certainly won't be back to stay here even at that price. We spent over £200 here and what a waste. Extremely disappointed! And to top of we can't have our refund as we paid third party and then cash for our meal! What a cop out.

Show more
Hannah , United Kingdom
Macdonald Manchester Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 176 reviews

It was underwhelming. I've not been to Manchester before this stay so I don't have much of a reference in the city but I travel a lot.

The hotel was okay. Cleanliness was average, food was average, staff were average, facilities were average. The one thing I would note is that the Nespresso Machine which is supposed to dispense fancy coffee in the room was filthy. The water reservoir in the machine was covered in mildew and fungus. It was clear that it had not been cleaned properly for a very long time. The same goes for the cups and glasses in the room. they were dirty. Whoever is cleaning them is not using detergent or cleaning them properly. Even the cups and cutlery in the restaurant were filthy. I had a waitress come and change my cup, she went to another table to get me a cup from but had to take that one away also because it was also dirty. She did apologize but it is embarrassing for the hotel isn't it... The hotel room safe box did not work, which was rather inconvenient. I was charged for breakfast one day when I hadn't had any. I sent an email marked as URGENT to the front desk to be printed and came down later on only to find it had not even been read and obviously not printed so I had to wait for close to 100 pages to be printed after they eventually found the email. On the positive side the printing was free of charge. :) Small things but they impacted on my overall experience at the hotel.

Show more
Mark , United Kingdom
Hilton Manchester Deansgate Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 152 reviews

Nice beds, good service and excellent facilities. Free safe. About 18 channels on the TV whih is standard, but i dont know why i was expecting satalite tv seen as we paid for a room? The pay per view was a rip off, it was over 20 pound to order a film, i found that excessive i wouldnt mind paying 10 pound.

We had a standard twin room which had everything you expect , quite modern, comfy , however the beds are a little close together but are nice comfy beds but are single beds, however and the room is big enough for a couple of nights but not massive no sort of living area, (it wouldnt fit 2 double bed ins) I imagine there are good views to be had if you get a high floor as the windows are large and the rooms have air con which is very refreshing but we were given a room on the 4th floor even though we asked for a high floor. They did let us check in early with no extra charge which was nice. The gym seemed adequate the pool ok for a little dip but a little small for serious swimming and its a little narrow so any more than 6-7 in it is packed really. The steam room and sauna and jaccuzzi was nice I did not try the breakfast and the prices for the room service and the mini bar were quite expensive to be expected at the hilton i suppose so we did not use this. We did use the fridge to store water and a few cokes that we bought, we emptied some of theres and put them back in the next day. When we checked out they tryed to charge 40 pound for the mini bar, as i said the prices are expensive , we didnt pay as we explained we hadnt used anything simply used the fridge, it must have sensors to know you have taken things out? so leave it alone! Bar 23 was good a little bit of a wait but worth it, the cocktails were nice, the views good and a nice chilled out ambionce. I would only really stay here for an hour or so, until the novity wares off as it is more like a resturant than a bar, you get given a table and have to order with a waitress who brings your drinks

Show more
stephen , United Kingdom
The Midland Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 46 reviews

Hair in the bath x 3. Pretty gross. Bathroom modern but finishing not done properly so tiling, grout work etc not the best.

High ceilings and small window so room needed more attention to be anywhere near worth £250 per night! Everything is cream, plenty of wall space for some art to brighten it up, picture rails x 2 with no pictures.. Just left bare so very boring and forgettable. Awful cheap furniture. Overpriced for what it is, wouldn't stay again. Travel lodge would have nicer rooms I bet, cheaper and same location.

Show more
Cora , Singapore
Clayton Hotel Manchester Airport
8.2 Excellent
Based on 255 reviews

We have been staying at Clayton's (formerly Bewleys) every year since it opened at Manchester Airport before flying back to the States.

We always felt relaxed and comfortable, and it had everything we could want. We'd start with a late afternoon cappuccino in the lounge, and after a little rest, had a beard ate in the dining room. We would have two favorite appetizers: caesar salad and pasta bolognese, (Always consistent- now not available). It was a hot day this year and we were surprised that the room had no air conditioning, and was stiflingly hot. In this day and age I've never come across a hotel that wasn't air conditioned. We asked at the desk if we could change to an air conditioned room, and learned that it was only in a limited number of "superior" rooms at an extra premium of 20 pounds. I am forewarned for the future. We did upgrade and I will say the room had new beds with very good mattresses and the ac was quiet. They even had blankets in the cupboard as an alternative to those heavy duvets.I never saw this difference advertised. The breakfasts are still wonderful, and the hotel provides free shuttles to your terminal, even though this year the vans were late. Feels like they are cutting corners. Still, for a one night stay before a flight, Clayton's has good facilities.

Show more
Kathleen , United States
The Ainscow Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 33 reviews

Very impressed with how upmarket the hotel appeared to be! Room was really big and well decorated. We had 2 massive bean bags in the room which was a different touch but looked good! There was tea and coffee available in the room and a flat screen tv.

Bed was clean and very comfortable. Bathroom looked newly fitted and well decorated. Towels were huge! Breakfast, although expensive was well presented and good choice. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Great location for exploring Manchester. We used Uber to get around which was cheap and quick. There is limited parking at the rear of the hotel which was full when we arrived so we parked opposite which only cost £3.50 for 24hours. Only negative was the slight traffic noise and no bottled water in room (I've stayed at cheaper hotels and it's usually provided). I would definitely use this hotel again and have already recommended it to a friend.

Show more
Rebecca , United Kingdom
Arora Hotel Manchester
8.5 Excellent
Based on 259 reviews

Arora Hotel did not stand out in any way. Room was cold and on our return it took quite a while to heat up, as we had to put on the heating ourselves when we got back to the hotel at 10.

30pm! The radiator in the bathroom never came on and it was freezing cold for our total stay. There was only one hand towel between the two of us! and two pillows, with nothing else in the wardrobe! so very basic amenities. Coffee was undrinkable! it was just awful, possibly the first time I have ever stayed in a hotel where I could not drink a cup of coffee in my room! Overall I paid 140+ euro for the room for the night not including breakfast, I found it very bad value for money. Location is good but that is all it had going for it. We were in Manchester for it's Christmas Market (9th in the world) and we discovered SACO Manchester.

It became a major highlight of our trip. Located about 5-7 minutes away from the train station, 1 street away from the tourist centre and a 15 minute stroll to the Christmas Market, this place had more surprises in store. The room is large with a dining table enough for 6 persons. The kitchen is equip to cook anything and everything. The bedroom delivers a superb night's rest. The toilet is large and provides a great hot shower, or if you have time, a nice relaxing soak in the bathtub. The living area is equipped with a comfy couch so you can lounge and surf the generous television channels available. Breakfast is provided, you just have to prepare it yourself, a tray of eggs, a loaf of bread, meat and milk and cereal. There's even a coffee machine for caffeine lovers like us. We definitely recommend this place.

Dining and restaurants in Manchester are the best in the UK, reasonable price and tasty. all sort of food around the world can be found in Manchester

hj apong ,Brunei Darussalam

City centre of Manchester is pretty small, walkable in half an hour. It has a good homey feel, good shopping and few good cultural places to see.

Worth visiting free entry John Rayland's Library, very gothic looking building, also free entry Manchester art gallery with few fine paintings. For the shopaholics there is a Arndale centre full of the usual shops and further from the centre of Manchester there is a Trafford Shopping Centre which is definitely worth of a visit. Transport is good, lots of busses around the city and a tram system. Tickets for buses are available from the driver and for trams from the machines which are easy to use.

More about Manchester

The city of Manchester is located in north England, often seen as the second most well-known city in England, of course with London leading the way. Manchester is made up of seven districts, all of which feature hotels and entertainment venues to fit most needs.

The city is served Manchester Airport, definitely one of the busiest and most important travel hubs in the United Kingdom. The city is also served by the United Kingdom’s fast and efficient rail system, with stations either at Picadilly or Victoria train stations.

The Museum of Science and Industry is a very popular destination for not only tourists but locals as well. Many school groups and families spend many afternoons at this museum, which houses the history of the region’s railway system and many other industry exhibits.

Of course, Manchester is home to the world-famous Manchester United Football Club Ltd. Because of its popularity, and the rivalries with other clubs of the surrounding area, hotels near Manchester United are guaranteed to be at full capacity during match times. It is therefore best practice to book well in advance.

There’s much more to see and experience in Manchester, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

Manchester is made up of seven districts, all of which feature hotels and entertainment venues to fit most needs. The city is served Manchester Airport , definitely one of the busiest and most important travel hubs in the United Kingdom. The city is also served by the United Kingdom’s fast and efficient rail system, with stations either at Picadilly or Victoria train stations. The Museum of Science and Industry is a very popular destination for not only tourists but locals as well. Many school groups and families spend many afternoons at this museum, which houses the history of the region’s railway system and many other industry exhibits. Of course, Manchester is home to the world-famous Manchester United Football Club Ltd . Because of its popularity, and the rivalries with other clubs of the surrounding area, hotels near Manchester United are guaranteed to be at full capacity during match times. It is therefore best practice to book well in advance. There’s much more to see and experience in Manchester, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
